thread.title: Martin Molloy

author: Martin Molloy
title: Martin Molloy
text:
This hotel is well located in the centre of Porto on Avenida dos Aliados. It’s very close to, and within walking distance of many of the cities attractions such as the cathedral, Sam Bento railway station, Torre dos Clérigos, ponte Luis 1 and the fashionable eating/drinking area of Ribeira.
The hotel is situated on the first floor (second if you think in the American way) and although there is a lift in the building, there is no lift to get you into the hotel, only a flight of stairs. There does however seem to be a chair lift for the mobility impaired.
The rooms are comfortable with en suite bathroom, tv and wi-fi in the rooms and to be honest for a 2 star hotel it was both good valued and a pleasant stay. The reception staff were very friendly and took an interest in how my day was etc. You can organise trips through them if you have not alreay pre-arranged anything. There is also a small bar in the hotel in the reception area.
You can opt for breakfast which was a simple affair of tea, coffee and watered down orange juice, bread rolls, croissants, ham, cheese, fruit and yogurts.
